result.execSummary:
The defendant CARSON R FROHN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CARSON R FROHN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lester H Liptak appeared in court for CARSON R FROHN.
Attorney Liptak requests to modify bond. 
ADA Zehr objects to bond modification. 
Court denies bond modification. 
Bond continued.

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant shall not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
No contact with Victim 1 and Victim 2. No contact with residence. Defendant may return one time to obtain belongings. To be arranged through Victim Witness. 
Comply with any DHS requirements. 
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.

Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CARSON R FROHN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lester H Liptak appeared by video for CARSON R FROHN.
